item.title: [req] wget in java
item.dc:creator: @byte byte
item.description:
@byte wrote:

Did you totally disregard my post?

Lifewire

Why Would I Use cURLand Not Wget?

cURL is a command line tool that allows you to transfer data to or from the internet and should not be confused with Wget. cURL can be used to download content from web pages.

item.title: [req] wget in java
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Use this instead, no inner classes. I was messing with inner classes at the time.

[code]import java.net.;
import java.io.;

public class WGet {

private void start() {

	try {

		System.out.print("URL to load data from: http://");
		BufferedReader scan = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));
		get("http://" + scan.readLine());
	} catch(Exception e) {

		e.printStackTrace();
	}
}

private void get(String url) {

	try {

		URLConnection connection = new URL(url).openConnection();
		String f[] = url.split("/");
		File file = new File(f[f.length - 1]);
		int length = connection.getContentLength();
		System.out.println("Loading " + file + " (which is " + connection.getContentType() + ":" + length + " bytes)...");
		InputStream instream = connection.getInputStream();
		FileOutputStream outstream = new FileOutputStream(file);
		int size = 0, copy = 0;
		while((copy = instream.read()) != -1) {

			outstream.write(copy);
			size++;
		}
		if(length != size) {

			System.err.println("Error: " + file + " corrupted in transfer.");
			instream.close();
			outstream.close();
		} else {

			System.out.println("Successfully loaded " + file + ":" + size + " bytes.");
			instream.close();
			outstream.close();
		}
	} catch(Exception e) {

		System.err.println("Error connecting to " + url);
	}
}

public static void main(String args[]) {

	new WGet().start();
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [req] wget in java
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

[code]import java.net.;
import java.io.;

public class WGet {

private WGet() {

	try {

		System.out.print("URL to load data from: http://");
		BufferedReader scan = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));
		Loader loader = new Loader("http://" + scan.readLine());
	} catch(Exception e) {

		e.printStackTrace();
	}
}

public static void main(String args[]) {

	new WGet();
}

class Loader {

	private Loader(String src) {

		try {

			URL url = new URL(src);
			URLConnection connection = url.openConnection();
			String f[] = src.split("/");
			File file = new File(f[f.length - 1]);
			int length = connection.getContentLength();
			System.out.println("Loading " + file + " (which is " + connection.getContentType() + ":" + length + " bytes)...");
			InputStream instream = connection.getInputStream();
			FileOutputStream outstream = new FileOutputStream(file);
			int size = 0, copy = 0;
			while((copy = instream.read()) != -1) {

				outstream.write(copy);
				size++;
			}
			if(length != size) {

				System.err.println("Error: " + file + " corrupted in transfer.");
				instream.close();
				outstream.close();
			} else {

				System.out.println("Successfully loaded " + file + ":" + size + " bytes.");
				instream.close();
				outstream.close();
			}
		} catch(Exception e) {

			System.err.println("Error connecting to " + src);
		}
	}
}

}[/code]

Pretty simple.
